security: Sharing this document could reveal internal processes for responding to inquiries and coordinating with other government agencies. Additionally, the sensitivity of employee security information and investigations is underscored, potentially exposing vulnerabilities if this information were mishandled. Quoting: "Please arrange for an appropriate response."
summary: A memo from the Office of the Deputy Attorney General to the FBI, forwarding a request from the Senate Select Committee and requesting an appropriate response.
summary_one_paragraph: On February 6, 1976, Steven K. Blackhurst, Assistant Special Counsel for Intelligence Coordination, sent a memo to John A. Mintz, Assistant Director of the Legal Counsel Division of the FBI, regarding a request from the Senate Select Committee dated February 9, 1976. Blackhurst attached the letter from the committee and instructed Mintz to arrange for an appropriate response, initiating a process for addressing the committee's inquiry.
title: Senate Select Committee Request dated February 9, 1976
origin_agency: Office of the Deputy Attorney General
recipient: John A. Mintz, Assistant Director, Legal Counsel Division, Federal Bureau of Investigation
sender: Steven K. Blackhurst, Assistant Special Counsel for Intelligence Coordination
